title.narrative: Conférences du Bureau régional de l'Asie pour 2014-2015

description.narrative:
IDRC's Asia Regional Office's lecture series has invited eminent scholars, policymakers, grassroots workers, and development researchers to lead seminar discussions since 2001.This grant will support the series through 2014-15.
Regional Office staff will organize a series of public policy dialogues and debates around Asia's major economic, political, and social issues. Events will be held in New Delhi, India, and at other locations in the region.
The project will cover travel and other expenses for visiting scholars. More specifically, the project's objectives are to: -provide a forum for IDRC partners to share their research findings, new ideas, and project experience with their peers, Delhi-based donors representatives, academics, policymakers, staff members, and others; -facilitate and promote efforts to articulate Asia's public policy issues; and -highlight IDRC's contribution to public policy and social science research through a series of commemorative lectures by influential policy researchers.
